channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: 10 million OFWs assured of better services under DOFil – Go
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Ten million Filipinos working abroad would be ensured of more efficient and responsive government services under the new version of the bill creating the Department of Overseas Filipinos, which President Duterte has certified as urgent.

item.title: CPP-NPA won’t declare holiday ceasefire
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: The Communist Party of the Philippines will not be calling a holiday ceasefire with state security forces and has given the green light to its armed wing, the New People’s Army, to carry out tactical offensives against state troopers.

item.title: Pfizer deal just delayed; Duque dropped the ball?
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The Philippines’ deal with drug manufacturer Pfizer for the procurement of coronavirus vaccines is still “in progress,” Philippine Ambassador to the United States Jose Manuel Romualdez said yesterday.

item.title: Philippine secures $13 billion in COVID-19 foreign funds
item.author: Mary Grace Padin
item.description: The Philippines has so far secured $13.36 billion in foreign loans and grants to finance its response to the coronavirus pandemic, the Department of Finance reported yesterday.

item.title: Palace: ICC statement political propaganda
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The International Criminal Court prosecutor’s statement on the war on drugs is just “political propaganda” that would not affect Philippine government affairs, officials said yesterday.

item.title: Fewer hungry Pinoys in Q4 – SWS
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Filipino families who experienced “involuntary hunger” dropped to 16 percent or about four million in the last quarter of the year, the Social Weather Stations said in its latest report.

item.title: Cops to hand out masks, shields; no more arrests
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Police officers will hand out face masks and face shields instead of immediately arresting violators of health and safety protocols, the Philippine National Police said yesterday.

item.title: 1,100 schools picked for face-to-face classes
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: More than 1,100 public schools across the country have been nominated for the pilot implementation of limited face-to-face classes in COVID-19 low-risk areas, according to the Department of Education.

item.title: Dawn masses a gift of hope – CBCP
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Filipino Catholics flocked to the first of the nine-day pre-dawn masses or Simbang Gabi yesterday despite the threat of COVID-19 – an act described by the officials of the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of the Philippines as a gift of hope.

item.title: DepEd: Schools are least sources of COVID-19 infection according to UNICEF
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: Education Secretary Leonor Briones on Wednesday asserted that schools are the least places where children could be infected with the coronavirus. But on what studies is her claim anchored in?
